required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: NKG2D CAR-T(KD-025) in the Treatment of Relapsed or Refractory NKG2DL+ Tumors
clinical_study.official_title: One-center, Open-label, Single-arm Clinical Study of the Safety and Effectiveness of NKG2D CAR-T Cells Infusion in the Treatment of Relapsed/ Refractory NKG2DL+ Tumors

lead_sponsor.agency: The Affiliated Nanjing Drum Tower Hospital of Nanjing University Medical School

clinical_study.source: The Affiliated Nanjing Drum Tower Hospital of Nanjing University Medical School

brief_summary.textblock: This is a Phase 1, single-arm, single-center, open-label study to evaluate the safety and effectiveness of NKG2D-based CAR-T cells infusion in the treatment of relapsed/refractory NKG2DL+ solid tumors.

detailed_description.textblock: In this study,the enrollment of the patients must meet the inclusion and exclusion criteria . All subjects will be asked to continue to undergo long-term gene safety follow-up.

primary_outcome.measure: The occurrence of AEs and SAEs during the study treatment
primary_outcome.description: An adverse event is any undesirable experience associated with the use of a medical product in a patient

secondary_outcome.description: overall survival refers to the period from being included in the test group to death caused by any reason

intervention.description: Autologous genetically modified anti-NKG2DLs CAR transduced T cells

facility.name: The Affiliated Nanjing Drum Tower Hospital of Nanjing University Medical School

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: The Affiliated Nanjing Drum Tower Hospital of Nanjing University Medical School
